definition: style of study/academic atmosphere/school discipline/school traditions

sentences.english: I like your teaching methods and teaching style.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡您的教學方法和教學風格。

sentences.english: The third part elaborates on the Lou family's education and study style.
sentences.chinese: 第三節闡述樓氏的教育與學風。

sentences.english: The style of study is an important part of school spirit.
sentences.chinese: 學風是校風的一個重要組成部分。

sentences.english: How has Segovia influenced your teaching style?
sentences.chinese: 塞戈維亞影響你的教學風格了嗎？

sentences.english: This one and foreign teaching style is completely different.
sentences.chinese: 這個和國外的教學風格是截然不同的。

sentences.english: He combines creative imagination and true scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 和真正的治學謹嚴學風。

sentences.english: I love the new campus good style of study, school spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我愛新校園裏良好的學風，校風。

sentences.english: They are written in a pedagogical style and contain only the most necessary information.
sentences.chinese: 他們是用一種教學風格，並且只包含最必要的信息。

sentences.english: Firstly, the good class atmosphere is the precondition of the formation of good style of study.
sentences.chinese: 其一，班風是良好學風形成的前提。

sentences.english: The development of study style is the ageless theme in the vocational schools.
sentences.chinese: 學風建設是高等學校各項工作的永恆的主題。

sentences.english: There is close relation between college Party construction and learning atmosphere construction.
sentences.chinese: 高校黨建工作與學風建設之間有着密切的聯繫。

sentences.english: The essay puts forward three facts to enhance the style of study construction.
sentences.chinese: 本文結合工作實際，提出了從三大方面加強學風建設。

sentences.english: Those two charateristics were just remarkable symbols during the period of Jiaqing and Daoguang.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個特徵也正是嘉道時期學風轉變的顯著標志。

sentences.english: Class two of grade three has excellent class discipline and study atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 三年級二班的班風好，學風濃。

sentences.english: All in all, Miss Long's teaching style has a positive effect on us.
sentences.chinese: 總之，龍老師的教學風格對我們有積極的影響。

definition: the tone of a school/campus atmosphere
scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study
a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
